intro: Thyroma, commonly known as the "devil's backbone," is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its unique, branched stem that resembles a spine. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Thyroma thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its foliage is aromatic and has been historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
